title: AttributeError: module 'shap.models' has no attribute 'TeacherForcingLogits'

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Indicates that a maintainer wants help on an issue or pull request

labels.name: documentation
labels.description: Relating to readthedocs, notebooks, and exposition in docstrings

body:
Hello,

I am using Shap 0.41.0, the latest at the time of writing this. I think there needs to be a code update to run_masker so that instead of calling:
`wrapped_model = shap.models.TeacherForcingLogits(f, similarity_model=model, similarity_tokenizer=tokenizer)`
The team might want to change it to:
`wrapped_model = shap.models.TeacherForcing.get_teacher_forced_logits(f, similarity_model=model, similarity_tokenizer=tokenizer)`
 
Here is the error I was getting:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
Cell In[10], line 2
      1 # SHAP explanation using masking option "blur(pixel_size, pixel_size)" for blurring
----> 2 shap_values = run_masker(X, mask_value="blur(56,56)")

Cell In[9], line 50, in run_masker(X, mask_value, max_evals, batch_size, fixed_context)
     47 masker = shap.maskers.Image(mask_value, X[index].shape)
     49 # wrap model with TeacherForcingLogits class
---> 50 wrapped_model = shap.models.TeacherForcingLogits(f, similarity_model=model, similarity_tokenizer=tokenizer)
     52 # build a partition explainer with wrapped_model and image masker
     53 explainer = shap.Explainer(wrapped_model, masker) 

AttributeError: module 'shap.models' has no attribute 'TeacherForcingLogits'
